section.docs:
Campaigns are a way to organize different things in Radium. Putting things in a campaign will allow you generate statistics for each one and provide a way to break down your company's performance.
One user is responsible for each campaign. They can approve who get to follow this campaign. They can also add more contacts to the campaign.

section.title: Routes & Permissions
section.docs:
* `POST /campaigns`: Team leaders or Gods * `GET /campaigns`: All Users according to scoping * `GET /campaigns/:id`: All users according to scoping * `PUT /campaigns/:id`: Campaign manager or Gods * `DELETE /campaigns/:id`: Campaign manager or Gods
### Scoping
You can have read access the following ways:
1. You are managing the campaign 2. You are following the campaign 3. The campaign is public 4. You are a God

section.title: Attributes
section.docs:
name
Required
A succinct name. Example: "Fall 2011"
description
Required
Long form text used to describe this campaign.
ends_at
Required
Date & Time for when the campaign ends.
target
The ammount of revenue this campaign should generate
currency
Currency for the target value. See the currency section for allowed values.
public
Inherits this setting from the account unless specified
user
Required
The ID for user who's managing this campaign.
NOTE: You can change this by specifying a user_id attribute.
contacts
All the contacts associated with this campaign.
NOTE: You can change this by specifying the contact_ids attribute. However, if you want to add one person, you will need to add the new id to existing array.
todos
All the todos that are associated with this campaign
deals
All the deals that are associated with this campaign
phone_calls
All the phone calls that are associated with this campaign (call list or otherwiser)
messages
All the messages that have been sent relating to this campaign
groups
All the groups associated with this campaign
products
All the products associated with this campaign
users
All the users who are working this campaign
followers
All the users who are following this campaign
notes
All the notes relating to this campaign
meetings
All the meetings relating to this campaign

New campaigns will be assigned to the user creating them unless the `user_id` attribute is given.
The associated contacts can also be set by providing the `contact_ids` attribute.
section.reference:
`POST https://api.radiumcrm.com/campaigns`
### Parameters
```javascript { "developer_api_key": "foo", "user_api_key": "bar", "campaign": { "name": "Campaign 3", "description": "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Proin risus. Praesent lectus.", "ends_at": "2011-12-21T14:55:25Z", "currency": "USD", "target": "10000.0", "user_id": 449, "approve_following_requests": true, "contact_ids": [1,2,3,5] } } ```

section.docs:
You can "reassign" a campaign by passing the `user_id` attribute.
You can add more contacts to a campaign by passing `contact_ids` **AND** including current ids plus the ones.
